docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Jan. 20 -- Acting President Ramon S. Castillo indicated in an interview tonight that Argentina had said her last word as far as the proposed joint rupture of relations with the Axis countries was concerned and that she...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Jan. 20 -- Acting President Ramon S. Castillo indicated in an interview tonight that Argentina had said her last word as far as the proposed joint rupture of relations with the Axis countries was concerned and that she intended to make no further concessions at the conference of American Foreign Ministers in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

headline.main: BUENOS AIRES FIRM; Castillo Says Majority in Argentina Oppose Plan at Rio Parley ATTACKS BY AXIS FEARED U.S. Offers to Conference Plan to Stabilize Currencies of All Latin Americas BUENOS AIRES FIRM FOR TIES TO AXIS

byline.original: By ARNALDO CORTESISpecial Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Jan. 21 -- Unanimous agreement by the twenty-one American republics on a resolution for severance of relations with the Axis powers was reached late today at a three-hour consultation in the office of Foreign Minister Oswaldo...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Jan. 21 -- Unanimous agreement by the twenty-one American republics on a resolution for severance of relations with the Axis powers was reached late today at a three-hour consultation in the office of Foreign Minister Oswaldo Aranha of Brazil, who is chairman of the Inter-American Conference.

docs.snippet: Although some 50 per cent of the nation's production is earmarked for the war effort, American manufacturers should allocate a larger proportion of their output than usual for export to the Latin American market, according to a survey released...
docs.lead_paragraph: Although some 50 per cent of the nation's production is earmarked for the war effort, American manufacturers should allocate a larger proportion of their output than usual for export to the Latin American market, according to a survey released yesterday by the foreign credit interchange bureau of the National Association of Credit Men.

headline.main: SHARE OF U.S. OUTPUT TO LATIN NEEDS URGED; Credit Men Say Producers Should Allot More Goods

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Jan. 22 -- Brazil plans to break off relations with the Axis forthwith as a demonstration of her determination and an example to the Inter-American Conference, to which she is host. The Brazilian Government expects Germany to...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Jan. 22 -- Brazil plans to break off relations with the Axis forthwith as a demonstration of her determination and an example to the Inter-American Conference, to which she is host. The Brazilian Government expects Germany to retaliate by declaring war, but President Getulio Vargas, Foreign Minister Oswaldo Aranha and other officials refuse to be disturbed by this prospect.

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Jan. 23 -- While political parleys took place behind closed doors at the Conference of American Foreign Ministers in Itamaraty Palace today subcommittees dealing with economic matters approved all but two resolutions which are...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Jan. 23 -- While political parleys took place behind closed doors at the Conference of American Foreign Ministers in Itamaraty Palace today subcommittees dealing with economic matters approved all but two resolutions which are tied to the settlement of political issues.

headline.main: RIO COMMITEES SPEED TRADE WORK; Sub-Groups Back Plans for Economic Protection and for Increase in Shipping

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Jan. 24 -- The Inter-American Conference of Foreign Ministers, now drawing toward a close here, will undoubtedly be looked upon in retrospect as a landmark in the history of the present World War and in the development of...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Jan. 24 -- The Inter-American Conference of Foreign Ministers, now drawing toward a close here, will undoubtedly be looked upon in retrospect as a landmark in the history of the present World War and in the development of Pan-Americanism; but the extent to which it has achieved success must naturally await the test of events.

headline.main: RIO CONFERENCE MARKS PAN-AMERICAN PROGRESS; Its Full Purport Depends Upon Action To Be Taken by Argentina and Chile

byline.original: By BERTRAM D. HULENWireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: A harvest of profits for imports of sorely needed goods has sent buyers into foreign fields in a feverish search for goods. In spite of impediments of tariff, black lists, price control, lack of shipping facilities and direct prohibition on purchase...
docs.lead_paragraph: A harvest of profits for imports of sorely needed goods has sent buyers into foreign fields in a feverish search for goods. In spite of impediments of tariff, black lists, price control, lack of shipping facilities and direct prohibition on purchase of foreign goods by government agencies, private enterprise for months has been sensing the shortage of goods and already has organized the movement of a huge volume of foreign-made goods.

headline.main: SEARCH FOR GOODS IS EXTENDED AFAR; Volume of Imports Mounts as Domestic Shortages Become Apparent SEARCH FOR GOODS IS EXTENDED AFAR

docs.snippet: Shipping operators engaged in South American trade were perturbed last week when mandatory decreases in freight rates on cargo moving from Argentina, Uruguay and Southern Brazil went into effect on all commodities.
docs.lead_paragraph: Shipping operators engaged in South American trade were perturbed last week when mandatory decreases in freight rates on cargo moving from Argentina, Uruguay and Southern Brazil went into effect on all commodities.

headline.main: FREIGHT-RATE CUTS WORRY OPERATORS; Shipping Men in Trade With South America Perplexed by 'Arbitrary' Ruling 25% RISE IS ELIMINATED Major Items Involved in the Order Are Linseed From Argentina and Coffee
